The Wellington Session
Current Archive Tunebooks Edit ABC Learning by Ear Venue

The Wellington Session happens on Tuesday nights from 7:30 p.m. at the Welsh Dragon Bar, 10/12 Cambridge Terrace, Wellington 6011, New Zealand. All players of traditional Irish music are welcome. The session starts slowly, as we work through beginner and recently learnt tunes:

  • Beginner’s tunes
  • New tunes
  • Other Tunes

If you are relatively new to playing this music, come along right at the start.

The pace usually picks up as the evening progresses, so if you are already fluent in tunes, come along after 8:30. Of course, we’d be happy to have experienced players playing slowly earlier on as well!

Find out more about us and upcoming sessions.

Beginner’s tunes

If you are starting to learn Irish music, have a go at learning these tunes. Come down to the slow session at 7:30 on Tuesday evenings at the Welsh Dragon to try them out. We’ll play them slowly so you can join in.

Tune Name▲▼ Key
▲▼		 Rhythm
▲▼		 Audio Control Speed Adjustment

100%

Rolling in the Ryegrass D reel
100%

New tunes

We pick one or two new tunes each week for homework and we play these at a moderate pace around 8:00 after the beginner part of the session. Here are the last eight tunes we’ve worked on:

Tune Name▲▼ Key
▲▼		 Rhythm
▲▼		 Audio Control Speed Adjustment
Morrison's Edor jig
100%
Musical Priest Bmin reel
100%
Earl's Chair D reel
100%
I Ne'er Shall Wean Her Ador jig
100%
High Road to Linton Amix reel
100%
Leslie's March D jig
100%
Caileach an Airgid D jig
100%
Tommy Peoples G reel
100%


If you're familiar with using an RSS feed you can subscribe to new tune announcements via RSS

Other Tunes

You can see the complete list of tunes we’ve been working on since October 2015 in our Current Tunes page.

There’s also a comprehensive list of tunes including some that we haven’t started yet is in our Archive page. Feel free to poke around.

For more information, follow us on Facebook, get in touch via email (admin@wellingtonsession.org), or just come along.

This website is built using Jekyll, and the source code is available at Github. You are welcome to grab the source and customise it for your own purposes. If they are any mistakes in the tunes, or other problems, send us an email at (admin@wellingtonsession.org).
